cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Lone Wolf deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nature's Resurgence
cards.text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."
—Maro
cards.originalText: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Nature's Revolt
cards.text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
cards.flavor: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Pride of Lions
cards.text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Pride of Lions deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.originalText: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Redwood Treefolk
cards.flavor:
And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning
"Are you crazy?"

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Rowen
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.

rulings.text: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

cards.originalText: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "One piece? Now there's a hundred!"
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Seeker of Skybreak
cards.text: {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.

rulings.text: It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target creature.

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Where dryads dance, seeds sprout and flowers bloom.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
Othello
cards.originalText: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Thorn Elemental deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Thoughtleech
cards.text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."
—Fyndhorn elder
cards.originalText: Whenever an island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Treefolk Seedlings
cards.text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.flavor:
Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.
—Llanowar saying

rulings.text: The toughness is continuously calculated.

cards.originalText: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of forests you control.

cards.name: Uktabi Wildcats
cards.text:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.
cards.originalText:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: No forest is so remote that the elves don't know its secrets.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Each spell has its own song, and the enchantress knows the dance for each.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Vernal Bloom
cards.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.flavor: Spring breathes the magic of new life.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability. It does not go on the stack.

cards.originalText: Whenever a forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.flavor: If you stop to listen, you can hear it grow.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Wing Snare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The elves long ago mastered the art of hunting with nets. They call it "fishing the sky."
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.
cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Some say Aladdin's third wish was for this ring.
cards.originalText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.
cards.originalText: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures in play.

cards.name: Caltrops
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
cards.flavor: The Eastern Paladin knew how highly his southern rival valued horses, so he gleefully prepared a suitable welcome.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.

cards.name: Charcoal Diamond
cards.text:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
cards.originalText:
Charcoal Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play that shares a creature type with it. (For example, if there are three Goblins in play, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.
cards.originalText: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Ensnaring Bridge
cards.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
cards.flavor: Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.

rulings.text: Ensnaring Bridge's effect checks the number of cards in your hand only while a player (including you) is declaring attackers. Once a creature has legally attacked, changing its power or the number of cards in your hand won't remove it from combat.

cards.originalText: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.

cards.name: Feroz's Ban
cards.text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor: Feroz is gone, but what remains is his final gift to his people: the right to be left alone.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Creature spells cost {2} more to play.

cards.name: Fire Diamond
cards.text:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
cards.originalText:
Fire Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeee!"
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Grafted Skullcap
cards.text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
cards.flavor: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw a card.
At the end of your turn, discard your hand.

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The Southern Paladin taught the airborne vermin to fear the storm that rains upward.
cards.originalText: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor:
Your heart's desire is found within.
—Saddlebag inscription
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon,
Meditationes Sacrae
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
cards.originalText:
Marble Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor: The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.
cards.originalText: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Moss Diamond
cards.text:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.originalText:
Moss Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.
cards.originalText: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Colossus
cards.text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
cards.originalText:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

cards.name: Pit Trap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
Never forget your feet
—Elvish expression meaning
"watch your step"
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sisay's Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.flavor: "I'm not one for pretty things," said Sisay. "Unless they're pretty useful as well."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sky Diamond
cards.text:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
cards.originalText:
Sky Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Static Orb
cards.text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
cards.flavor: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.

rulings.text: If there are two of these on the battlefield, they do not add together. The result is that only two permanents can be untapped.

cards.originalText: If Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.

cards.name: Storm Cauldron
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land during each of their turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

cards.originalText:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in their hand on the bottom of their library in any order, then draws that many cards.

rulings.text: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
First strike

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Adarkar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Underground River
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

rulings.text: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can attack as though it weren't a Wall.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.
